channel.title: RS Canvas
channel.description:
Let's say I want to access the RS Canvas (the one that renders what you see), at the moment i've found two, a Canvas variabla, and _xx.class that extends Canvas, I was wondering which one should I use. (Maybe this might seem like a newb question but i've never used Canvases on Java so I don't know which one to use.
P.S: I could also use some good reference on Java2D and Canvases.

item.title: RS Canvas
item.dc:creator: @RsN RsN
item.description:
@RsN wrote:

I know the difference between a field and a class,between static and non-static and all of that, I just wanted to make sure where was it better to get the canvas from, whether to inject the accessor method into the class that extended the canvas or the variable, then once people answered my question i realized there was only one field that got the canvas from the class, so i figured it was easier to make the accesor to the field rather than finding the field and then using a method injected into the class. I know im no java god, but i know im not stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: RS Canvas
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Yea, me aswell. The problem is most people want to make a bot and then try to learn java while doing it. We learned java first and then created a bot. If they don’t know the difference between a variable and a class, then they shouldn’t even think about creating a bot. They should start by creating simple things and then create harder things and then when they know everything about java, then they can consider creating a bot

Read full topic

item.title: RS Canvas
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

well the canvas variable is simple an instance of the xx_class
around somewhere, it does
“Canvas rsCanvas = new xx_class();”

for referance to it, you could look at the java api docs, file:///C:/Program%20Files/Java/jdk1.6.0/docs/index.html

if you want to draw on it, call getGraphics() then use that, you can do addMouseListener or something if you want to see the events sent to it, well theres quite a few stuff you can do with that canvas

and 1337h4x, if you’re totally missing the point, then just dont post…

Read full topic
